title: Calories in Orange Bell Pepper
meta_description: Discover calories in orange bell pepper, including carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per medium serving for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Medium-sized (119g), raw, fresh, no added seasonings or oils.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, growing conditions, and preparation method. Check labels or apps for specific varieties.

quick_answer.text: One medium orange bell pepper provides ~37 kcal, mainly from carbs with good fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

faqs.q: How many calories in one orange bell pepper?
faqs.a: About 37 kcal for a medium raw orange bell pepper.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in orange bell pepper?
faqs.a: Roughly 7.5 g carbs, including 2.5 g fiber and 5 g sugars per medium pepper.

faqs.q: Is orange bell pepper low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.4 g total fat per medium pepper, with minimal saturated fat.

faqs.q: Calories in cooked vs raw orange bell pepper?
faqs.a: Raw is ~37 kcal; cooking methods like roasting add minimal calories unless oil is used.

faqs.q: How does orange bell pepper compare to green?
faqs.a: Orange is sweeter and slightly higher in calories (~37 vs ~24 kcal per medium) due to ripeness.
